events.message: Applicant submitted their personal loan application online, indicating the loan is intended to cover upcoming medical expenses.
The application was reviewed for proper categorization and classified under Personal Loan due to medical expense keywords.
Loan officer Samantha was assigned to the case to ensure individual attention for the personal loan application.
The loan officer conducted an initial review of the application documents and verified applicant eligibility criteria.
Additional documentation was requested including recent pay stubs, medical bills, and proof of residency for validation.
Applicant promptly submitted all requested documents including medical invoices, pay stubs, and identification copies.
Credit check returned an average score with no major red flags that could negatively affect loan approval.
Risk assessment concluded moderate risk due to the applicant’s current debt levels and recent medical expenses.
An offer outlining loan terms, interest rate, and repayment schedule was presented to the applicant for review.
Applicant provided positive feedback on the offer, requesting minor clarifications regarding early repayment options.
Application was escalated to management for review of special repayment terms requested by the applicant.
Loan was approved after thorough review, including approval for flexible repayment schedule as requested.
Funds were successfully disbursed to the applicant’s account to cover immediate medical expenses.
Loan officer followed up with the applicant to ensure all repayment terms are clear and to check satisfaction.
The loan application case was formally closed after confirming all processes and applicant satisfaction.
